briefTitle: Study of Pyridoxine for Hand-Foot Syndrome
officialTitle: Double-Blind Phase III Study of Pyridoxine vs Placebo for the Prevention of Capecitabine-induced Hand-Foot Syndrome
summary: Although pyridoxine has been used empirically for the prevention of capecitabine associated hand-foot syndrome (HFS), its efficacy needs to be demonstrated in prospective controlled trials. The investigators therefore performed a prospective randomized double-blind study to determine whether pyridoxine 200 mg/day can prevent the development of HFS when given concurrently with capecitabine. The investigators also tested the ability of pyridoxine to treat primary occurrence of grade 2-3 HFS.

primaryOutcome.measure: Cumulative Dose of Capecitabine Until the Development of Grade 2 or Higher Hand-foot Syndrome
